update_hangman(body_dict: Dict[str, str]) → None[source]

Update the hangman inserting the part of the body specified in the input paramter kargs. So we have a dictionary of parameter that will be by default {“head” : “”,”larm” : “”,”body” : “”,”rarm” : “”,”lleg” : “”,”rleg” : “”,”lfoot”: “”,”rfoot”: “”}

update_window_title() → None[source]

simply update the title of the window with the right difficulty

update_word_pad(reset_cursor: bool = False, default_lett: Optional[Dict[int, str]] = None, cursor_position: Optional[int] = None) → None[source]

Update with the new word

Parameters

  • reset_cursor – True if we want that the cursor go back to the start of the word

  • default_lett – A dictionary containing default value for some position of the word. Can be used to indicate an update

  • cursor_position – An integer representing the position of the cursor in the word

Returns

None

property window

Return the window of the game

write_guess_letter(current_pos: int, key: str) → None[source]

Write a letter in the current position

Parameters

  • current_pos – the current position of the cursor WRT the word

  • key – the pressed key

Returns

None

write_log(message: str, insert: str) → None[source]

Parameters

  • insert – The string that complete the message (by formatting)

Returns

None

class game.game_state.GameSettings(MAX_ROUND_TIME: str = 'MAX ROUND TIME', TOT_ROUND_NUMBER: str = 'TOT ROUND NUMBER', GAME_DIFFICULTY: str = 'GAME DIFFICULTY', MAX_ROUND_SCORE: str = 'MAX ROUND SCORE', WORD_LENGTH: str = 'WORD LENGHT', PENALTY: str = 'PENALTY', HINT_NUMBER: str = 'HINT NUMBER', HINT_PENALTY: str = 'HINT PENALTY', INTRO: str = 'INTRO', EASY_SETUP: Tuple[Tuple[str, Union[str, int, Tuple[int, int]]]] = (('MAX ROUND TIME', 60), ('TOT ROUND NUMBER', 10), ('GAME DIFFICULTY', 'Easy'), ('MAX ROUND SCORE', 100), ('WORD LENGHT', (5, 7)), ('PENALTY', 1), ('HINT NUMBER', (3, 5)), ('HINT PENALTY', 0), ('INTRO', 'You stupid newbie')), MEDIUM_SETUP: Tuple[Tuple[str, Union[str, int, Tuple[int, int]]]] = (('MAX ROUND TIME', 300), ('TOT ROUND NUMBER', 10), ('GAME DIFFICULTY', 'Medium'), ('MAX ROUND SCORE', 100), ('WORD LENGHT', (7, 9)), ('PENALTY', 1), ('HINT NUMBER', (2, 4)), ('HINT PENALTY', 0), ('INTRO', 'You that avoid difficulties')), HARD_SETUP: Tuple[Tuple[str, Union[str, int, Tuple[int, int]]]] = (('MAX ROUND TIME', 600), ('TOT ROUND NUMBER', 10), ('GAME DIFFICULTY', 'Hard'), ('MAX ROUND SCORE', 100), ('WORD LENGHT', (9, 11)), ('PENALTY', 1), ('HINT NUMBER', (1, 3)), ('HINT PENALTY', 0), ('INTRO', 'You foolish')), VERY_HARD_SETUP: Tuple[Tuple[str, Union[str, int, Tuple[int, int]]]] = (('MAX ROUND TIME', 1200), ('TOT ROUND NUMBER', 10), ('GAME DIFFICULTY', 'Very Hard'), ('MAX ROUND SCORE', 100), ('WORD LENGHT', (11, 18)), ('PENALTY', 2), ('HINT NUMBER', (1, 3)), ('HINT PENALTY', 1), ('INTRO', 'You stupid foolish')))[source]
classmethod get_settings(difficulty: str) → Dict[str, Union[str, int, Tuple[int, int]]][source]

Return the setting of the corresponding difficulty

class game.game_state.GameStatus(settings: game.game_state.GameSetting)[source]

Describe the current state of the game in terms of: - current round - current word - number of guessed letters - number of wrong guessed letters - state of the word to guess - game settings - length of the current word to guess - number of hints

property game_settings

Return the current game settings

property len_current_word: int

Return the length of the current word

next_round(word: str) → None[source]

Start a new round updating the current state with a new state: 1. increments the round counter 2. reset all the other counter 3. do other useful but uninteresting stuff

property number_of_guessed_letters: int

Return the number of letters the user has guessed

property number_of_used_hints: int

Return the number of used hint

property number_of_wrong_letters: int

Return the number of wrong guess

property penalty: int

Return the penalty counter

property round: int

Return the current round of the game

property score: int

Return the score of the user

update_word_state(idx: int, letter: str) → None[source]

Update the state of the word inserting in the index idx the letter “letter”

property word: str

Return the current word to guess

property word_state: List[str]

Return the state of the current word, i.e., which letters have been guessed
